intro: Euporteria, commonly known as the false holly, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Ericaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are shrubs native to various regions in the Americas. The plants typically have evergreen leaves and produce small, bell-shaped flowers that are often white or pink in color. Euporteria species are characterized by their clustered growth habit and are often found in acidic, well-drained soils. They are sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to their attractive foliage and flowering display.
